problem_text: This is a GeomVerse problem. If the angle EBD is vertical to CBA and the adjacent angles BAC and BAF are complementary, compute the degree of the BCA angle. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.patches as patches
import numpy as np

# Coordinates
A = (34.23, 34.23)
B = (34.23, 15034.23)
C = (11864.36, 11864.36)
D = (-17819.93, 19818.239999999998)
E = (34.23, 26316.62)
F = (-3501.3, 3569.76)

# Create figure and axis
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 10))

# Draw the lime triangle (A, B, C)
lime_triangle = patches.Polygon([A, B, C], closed=True, color="lime", alpha=0.6)
ax.add_patch(lime_triangle)

# Draw the cyan triangle (B, D, E)
cyan_triangle = patches.Polygon([B, D, E], closed=True, color="cyan", alpha=0.6)
ax.add_patch(cyan_triangle)

# Draw angle markers
def draw_angle_marker(ax, center, p1, p2, radius, angle_text, color="gray", alpha=0.8):
    '''Draws an angle marker and label.'''
    angle1 = np.arctan2(p1[1] - center[1], p1[0] - center[0])
    angle2 = np.arctan2(p2[1] - center[1], p2[0] - center[0])
    
    if angle2 < angle1:
        angle2 += 2 * np.pi

    theta = np.linspace(angle1, angle2, 100)
    x = center[0] + radius * np.cos(theta)
    y = center[1] + radius * np.sin(theta)
    ax.fill(x, y, color=color, alpha=alpha)

    # Add angle text
    mid_angle = (angle1 + angle2) / 2
    text_x = center[0] + (radius + 1) * np.cos(mid_angle)
    text_y = center[1] + (radius + 1) * np.sin(mid_angle)
    ax.text(text_x, text_y, angle_text, fontsize=14, ha="center", va="center")

# Add angle markers
draw_angle_marker(ax, B, D, E, radius=2, angle_text=r"$35^circ$")
draw_angle_marker(ax, E, B, D, radius=2, angle_text=r"$70^circ$")
draw_angle_marker(ax, A, B, F, radius=2, angle_text=r"$45^circ$")

# Add labels
ax.text(A[0], A[1], "A", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="top")
ax.text(B[0], B[1], "B", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="bottom")
ax.text(C[0], C[1], "C", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="top")
ax.text(D[0], D[1], "D", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="top")
ax.text(E[0], E[1], "E", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="bottom")
ax.text(F[0], F[1], "F", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="top")

# Draw line AF
ax.plot([A[0], F[0]], [A[1], F[1]], color="black", alpha=0.6)

# Configure the plot
ax.set_xlim(-19965.77, 15034.23)
ax.set_ylim(-4965.77, 30034.23)
ax.set_aspect("equal")
ax.axis("off")

# Show the plot
plt.show()

ext_info.cot: The degrees of the EDB and the DEB angles of the BDE triangle are 35 and 70, so the degree of the EBD angle $= 180 - 35 - 70 = 75$. The angle CBA is vertical to the angle EBD so the degree of the CBA angle = 75. The sum of the degrees of an angle and its complementary angle is 90. The BAC angle has a complementary angle with degree 45 so the degree of the BAC angle is 90 - 45 = 45. The degrees of the BAC and the CBA angles of the ABC triangle are 45 and 75, so the degree of the BCA angle $= 180 - 45 - 75 = 60$. Therefore the final answer is 60.
